New Records: Alek Thomas became the ninth player in MLB history with a game-tying, pinch-hit home run in the eighth inning or later of a postseason game, and the youngest player ever to do it.
Key Match Events: Alek Thomas hit a two-run home run against the Philadelphia Phillies in the bottom of the eighth inning, tying the game and sending a sellout crowd into a frenzy.
The Diamondbacks' bullpen devolved into chaos after Thomas' home run.
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks trailed the Phillies 5-3 in the game and 2-1 in the series, with veteran closer Craig Kimbrel on the mound.
Post-Match Reflections: Alek Thomas said that hitting the home run was'something that you see in your dreams' and that it was 'awesome' and 'unreal.'
Longoria said that Thomas' home run was 'definitely something that you see in your dreams' and that it was 'awesome.'
Thomas' home run will go down as one of the best moments in the history of the Diamondbacks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thomas' home run was the first pinch-hit homer of his career, and it propelled the Diamondbacks into the thick of the NLCS.
The Diamondbacks need just two more wins to stamp their ticket to the World Series.
Thomas has struggled against curveballs since making his major league debut last May, hitting.167 on curveballs in the regular season with a 27.1 percent whiff rate.
Others: Thomas entered the game as a pinch hitter, a challenge he had not yet faced in the playoffs.
Thomas had only 11 career pinch hit opportunities in his career entering Game 4 on Friday, and he had been quite productive, going 4-for-10 with a triple and three singles.
